==Events==
* [[462]] &ndash; Possible start of first Byzantine [[indiction|indiction cycle]].
* [[717]] &ndash; [[Siege of Constantinople (717–718)|Siege of Constantinople]]: The Muslim [[Navy fleet|armada]] with 1,800 ships, is defeated by the [[Byzantine navy]] through the use of [[Greek fire]].
*[[1270]] &ndash; King [[Stephen V of Hungary]] writes his walk to the ''antiquum castellum'' near [[Miholjanec]], where the [[Sword of Attila]] was recently discovered.
*[[1355]] &ndash; King [[Tvrtko I of Bosnia]] writes ''In castro nostro Vizoka vocatum'' from the old town of [[Visoki]].
*[[1449]] &ndash; [[Tumu Crisis]] &ndash; [[Mongol Empire|Mongols]]capture the [[Emperor of China]].
*[[1529]] &ndash; The Spanish fort of [[Sancti Spiritu (Argentina)|Sancti Spiritu]], the first one built in modern [[Argentina]], is destroyed by natives.
*[[1532]] &ndash; Lady [[Anne Boleyn]] is made [[Marquess of Pembroke]] by her [[Engagement|fiancé]], King [[Henry VIII of England|Henry VIII]] of [[England]].
*[[1604]] &ndash; [[Adi Granth]], now known as [[Guru Granth Sahib]], the holy scripture of [[Sikhs]], was first installed at [[Harmandir Sahib]].
*[[1644]] &ndash; [[Battle of Tippermuir]]: [[James Graham, 1st Marquess of Montrose]] defeats the [[Earl of Wemyss]]'s [[Covenanters]], reviving the [[Cavalier|Royalist]] cause.
*[[1715]] &ndash; King [[Louis XIV of France]] dies after a reign of 72 years—the longest of any major [[Europe]]an [[monarch]].
*[[1763]] &ndash; [[Catherine II of Russia]] endorses [[Ivan Betskoy]]'s plans for a [[Foundling Home in Moscow]]
*[[1772]] &ndash; The [[Mission San Luis Obispo de Tolosa]] is founded in [[San Luis Obispo, California]].
*[[1774]] &ndash; [[Province of Massachusetts Bay|Massachusetts Bay]] colonists rise up in the bloodless [[Powder Alarm]].
*[[1804]] &ndash; [[3 Juno|Juno]], one of the four largest [[asteroid]]s in the [[Main Belt]], is discovered by the German [[astronomer]] [[Karl Ludwig Harding]].
*[[1831]] &ndash; The high honor of ''[[Order of St. Gregory the Great]]'' is established by [[Pope Gregory XVI]] of the [[Vatican State]] to recognize high support for the Vatican or for the [[Pope]], by a man or a woman, and not necessarily a [[Roman Catholic]].
*[[1836]] &ndash; [[Narcissa Whitman]], one of the first English-speaking white women to settle west of the [[Rocky Mountains]], arrives at [[Walla Walla, Washington]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Chantilly]] &ndash; [[Confederate States of America|Confederate Army troop]]s defeat a group of retreating [[United States Army|Union Army troop]]s in [[Chantilly, Virginia]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; American Civil War: the [[Confederate Army]]  [[General]] [[John Bell Hood]] orders the evacuation of [[Atlanta, Georgia]], ending a four-month [[siege]] by General [[William Tecumseh Sherman]].
*[[1870]] &ndash; [[Franco-Prussian War]]: the [[Battle of Sedan]] is fought, resulting in a decisive [[Kingdom of Prussia|Prussian]] victory.
*[[1873]] &ndash; [[Cetshwayo]] ascends to the throne as king of the [[Zulu Kingdom|Zulu]] nation following the death of his father [[Mpande]].
*[[1878]] &ndash; [[Emma Nutt]] becomes the world's first female telephone operator when she is recruited by [[Alexander Graham Bell]] to the Boston Telephone Dispatch Company.
*[[1880]] &ndash; The army of [[Mohammad Ayub Khan]] is routed by the British at the [[Battle of Kandahar]], ending the [[Second Anglo-Afghan War]]
*[[1894]] &ndash; Over 400 people die in the [[Great Hinckley Fire]], a [[forest fire]] in [[Hinckley, Minnesota]].
*[[1897]] &ndash; The [[Boston]] [[Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority#Subways and elevated railways|subway]] opens, becoming the first underground [[rapid transit]] system in [[North America]].
*[[1902]] &ndash; ''[[A Trip to the Moon]]'', considered one of the first [[science fiction films]], is released in [[France]].
*[[1905]] &ndash; [[Alberta]] and [[Saskatchewan]] join the [[Canada|Canadian]] confederation.
*[[1906]] &ndash; The [[International Federation of Intellectual Property Attorneys]] is established.
*[[1911]] &ndash; The [[armored cruiser]] [[Greek cruiser Georgios Averof|''Georgios Averof'']] is commissioned into the [[Hellenic Navy|Greek Navy]]. It now serves as a [[museum ship]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[St. Petersburg]], [[Russian Empire|Russia]], changes its name to [[Petrograd]].
*  1914   &ndash; The last [[Passenger Pigeon]], a female named [[Martha (Passenger Pigeon)|Martha]], dies in captivity in the [[Cincinnati Zoo]].
*[[1920]] &ndash; The ''[[Fountain of Time]]'' opens as a tribute to the 100 years of peace between the United States and Great Britain following the [[Treaty of Ghent]].
*[[1923]] &ndash; The [[Great Kantō earthquake]] devastates [[Tokyo]] and [[Yokohama]], killing about 105,000 people.
*[[1928]] &ndash; [[Ahmet Zogu]] declares [[Albania]] to be a [[monarchy]] and proclaims himself king.
*[[1934]] &ndash; [[SMJK Sam Tet]] is founded by Father Fourgs from the St. Michael Church, [[Ipoh]], [[Perak]], [[Malaysia]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Nazi Germany]] and [[Slovak Republic (1939–1945)|Slovakia]] [[Invasion of Poland|invade]] [[Second Polish Republic|Poland]], beginning the European phase of World War II.
*  1939   &ndash; General [[George C. Marshall]] becomes [[Joint Chiefs of Staff|Chief of Staff]] of the [[United States Army]].
*  1939   &ndash; The [[Wound Badge]] for [[Wehrmacht]], [[SS]], [[Kriegsmarine]], and [[Luftwaffe]] soldiers is instituted. The final version of the [[Iron Cross]] is also instituted on this date.
*  1939   &ndash; [[Switzerland]] mobilizes its forces and the [[Swiss Parliament]] elects [[Henri Guisan]] to head the [[Swiss Army]] (an event that can happen only during war or mobilization).
*  1939   &ndash; [[Adolf Hitler]] signs an order to begin the [[Action T4|systematic euthanasia of mentally ill and disabled people]].
*[[1951]] &ndash; The [[United States]], [[Australia]] and [[New Zealand]] sign a mutual defense pact, called the [[ANZUS Treaty]].
*[[1952]] &ndash; ''[[The Old Man and the Sea]]'', the [[Pulitzer Prize for Fiction|Pulitzer Prize]]-winning novel by [[Ernest Hemingway]], is first published.
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[Iceland]] expands its fishing zone, putting it into conflict with the [[United Kingdom]], beginning the [[Cod Wars]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; The [[Eritrean War of Independence]] officially begins with the shooting of the [[Ethiopia]]n police by [[Hamid Idris Awate]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[Khmer–Chinese Friendship Association]] is banned in [[Cambodia]]
*[[1969]] &ndash; A [[coup]] in [[Libya]] brings [[Muammar Gaddafi]] to power.
*1969 &ndash; [[Tran Thien Khiem]] becomes [[Leaders of South Vietnam|Prime Minister]] of [[South Vietnam]] under President [[Nguyen Van Thieu]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; Attempted assassination of [[King Hussein of Jordan]] by Palestinian guerrillas, who attack his motorcade.
*[[1972]] &ndash; In [[Reykjavík]], [[Iceland]], [[United States|American]] [[Bobby Fischer]] beats [[Russia]]n [[Boris Spassky]] to become the [[World Chess Championship|world chess champion]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; The ''[[SR-71 Blackbird]]'' sets (and holds) the record for flying from [[New York]] to [[London]] in the time of 1 hour, 54 minutes and 56.4 seconds at a speed of {{convert|1435.587|mph|km/h}}.
*[[1979]] &ndash; The American space probe ''[[Pioneer 11]]'' becomes the first spacecraft to visit [[Saturn]] when it passes the [[planet]] at a distance of {{convert|21000|km|mi}}.
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[Terry Fox]]'s [[Marathon of Hope]] ends near Thunder Bay, Ontario.
*  1980   &ndash; Major General [[Chun Doo-hwan]] becomes [[President of South Korea]], following the resignation of [[Choi Kyu-hah]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; A ''[[coup d'état]]'' in the [[Central African Republic]] overthrows [[List of heads of state of the Central African Republic and Central African Empire|President]] [[David Dacko]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; The United States [[Air Force Space Command]] is founded.
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Cold War]]: [[Korean Air Flight 007]] is shot down by a [[Soviet Union]] jet fighter when the commercial aircraft enters [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] airspace. All 269 on board die, including [[United States Congress|Congressman]]  [[Larry McDonald|Lawrence McDonald]].
*[[1985]] &ndash; A joint [[United States|American]]–[[France|French]] expedition locates the wreckage of the {{RMS|Titanic}}.
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Uzbekistan]] declares independence from the [[Soviet Union]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; The death of [[Diana, Princess of Wales]] is announced by [[Buckingham Palace]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; The [[Beslan school hostage crisis]] commences when armed terrorists take children and adults hostage in [[Beslan]] in [[North Ossetia]], Russia.
